content.text: On the axes below, sketch the graph of \(y = (x - 2)(x + 1)(3 - x)\), stating the intercepts on the coordinate axes
Hence write down the values of \(x\) such that \((x - 2)(x + 1)(3 - x) > 0\)
Given that \(y = \frac{\mathrm{e}^{2x - 3}}{x^2 + 1}\), find \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}}\)
Hence, given that \(y\) is increasing at the rate of 2 units per second, find the exact rate of change of \(x\) when \(x = 2\)
Write down the largest possible domain for the function f
Find \(\mathrm{f}^{-1}(x)\) and its domain
f(x) = 4 ln(2x âˆ’ 1)
Solve \(\mathrm{gh}(x) = 7\)
On the axes below, draw the \(v - t\) graph for the runner
Find the total distance covered by the runner in 125 s
The diagram shows the \(x - t\) graph for a runner, where displacement, \(x\), is measured in metres and time, \(t\), is measured in seconds
The displacement, \(x\) m, of a particle from a fixed point at time \(t\) s is given by \(x = 6\cos \left(3t + \frac{\pi}{3}\right)\)
Find the acceleration of the particle when \(t = \frac{2\pi}{3}\) .
Given that the coefficient of \(x^{2}\) in the expansion of \(\left(1 + x\right)\left(1 - \frac{x}{2}\right)^{n}\) is \(\frac{25}{4}\) , find the value of the positive integer \(n\)
Find the value of \(A\) and of \(b\)
Using your values of \(A\) and \(b\), find
the value of \(y\) when \(x = 2\),
the positive value of \(x\) when \(y = 4\)

It is known that \(y = A \times 10^{bx^2}\), where \(A\) and \(b\) are constants. When \(\lg y\) is plotted against \(x^2\), a straight line passing through the points (3.63, 5.25) and (4.83, 6.88) is obtained
Show that \(\mathrm{p}(x) = (x + 4)(Ax^{2} + Bx + C)\), where \(A\), \(B\) and \(C\) are integers to be found
Hence factorise \(\mathrm{p}(x)\)
Find the remainder when \(\mathrm{p}^{\prime}(x)\) is divided by \(x\)
The polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x) = a x^{3} + b x^{2} - 19 x + 4\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants, has a factor \(x + 4\) and is such that \(2\mathrm{p}(1) = 5\mathrm{p}(0)\)
Find, in radians, the angle \(AOB\)
Find the area of \(ABC\), giving your answer in the form \(kr^2\), where \(k\) is a constant
Given that the perimeter of \(ABC\) is \(12\mathrm{cm}\), find the value of \(r\)
In this question all lengths are in centimetres

The diagram shows the figure \(ABC\). The arc \(AB\) is part of a circle, centre \(O\), radius \(r\), and is of length \(1.45r\). The point \(O\) lies on the straight line \(CB\) such that \(CO = 0.5r\)
Find \(\overrightarrow{OX}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{b}\), giving your answer in its simplest form
Find \(\overrightarrow{AC}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{b}\)
Given that \(\overrightarrow{OY} = h\overrightarrow{OX}\), find \(\overrightarrow{AY}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\), \(\mathbf{b}\) and \(h\)
Given that \(\overrightarrow{AY} = \overrightarrow{mAC}\), find the value of \(h\) and of \(m\)

The diagram shows the triangle \(OAC\). The point \(B\) is the midpoint of \(OC\). The point \(Y\) lies on \(AC\) such that \(OY\) intersects \(AB\) at the point \(X\) where \(AX:XB = 3:1\). It is given that \(\overrightarrow{OA} = \mathbf{a}\) and \(\overrightarrow{OB} = \mathbf{b}\)
Show that \(\frac{1}{x + 1} +\frac{2}{3x + 10}\) can be written as \(\frac{5x + 12}{3x^2 + 13x + 10}\)

The diagram shows part of the curve \(y = \frac{5x + 12}{3x^2 + 13x + 10}\), the line \(x = 2\) and a straight line of gradient 1. The curve intersects the \(y\)-axis at the point \(P\). The line of gradient 1 passes through \(P\) and intersects the \(x\)-axis at the point \(Q\). Find the area of the shaded region, giving your answer in the form \(a + \frac{2}{3}\ln \bigl(b\sqrt{3}\bigr)\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants
Given that \(2\cos x = 3\tan x\) , show that \(2\sin^{2}x + 3\sin x - 2 = 0.\)
Hence solve \(2\cos \left(2\alpha +\frac{\pi}{4}\right) = 3\tan \left(2\alpha +\frac{\pi}{4}\right)\) for \(0< \alpha < \pi\) radians, giving your answers in terms of \(\pi\)
